newsitem.title: USA: Baseball player sentenced for defrauding Prudential.
newsitem.headline: Baseball player sentenced for defrauding Prudential.

text.p: A former Major League Baseball player was sentenced Thursday to 63 months in a federal prison for defrauding Prudential Securities last year.
John D'Acquisto, 44, of San Diego, had been convicted by a Manhattan federal jury on July 3 of conspiracy, executing a forged security and wire fraud.
D'Acquisto, born in 1951, broke into the majors in 1973 as a pitcher with the San Francisco Giants and last played with the Oakland Athletics in 1982.

Each charge involved allegations that D'Acquisto had tried to open a trading account at Prudential Securities by presenting as collateral a forged $200 million certificate of deposit purportedly drawn on Banco Santander in Irun, Spain.
